intro: Arthrophyllum pacificum, commonly known as the Pacific arthrophyllum, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest region of North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in dense clusters and bloom in early summer. Arthrophyllum pacificum is valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife and its aesthetic appeal in native plant gardens.
